reviews.name: The game that asks for too much.
reviews.title: The game that asks for too much.
reviews.text: Although this game can be fun at times, it‚Äôs greatest flaws are the pay to play features, and it‚Äôs constant demand for you to give it your all. What do I mean by that? Well there are seasonal Pok√©mon, Pok√©mon that only come out during certain times of the year and legendaries that come out once or twice one year. Not a year, but once. It makes it difficult for returning players to get back in the grind set. If you miss a community day you may not see that Pok√©mon again. And if a Pok√©mon is only exclusive to raids you can only have one free raid a day, so you‚Äôre stuck with whichever iv you get. That is unless you pony up the cash to buy another raid pass. Another issue this game is how much internet it demands. I have a iPhone 11, running it at low settings yet CSGO runs at 120 fps on the same internet without lag, but a master league battle buffers for 5 seconds after each charge move. The lag is so bad that it seems to give opponents 3 shields and causes your own shields to fail. The PVP aspect needs to be patched severely. Overall I think I‚Äôll keep the cycle of only installing this game when something interesting happens because frankly this game wants too much from the player, whether or not it‚Äôs asking for grind or for money, I‚Äôm done supporting this game. Hopefully you‚Äôll make a wise decision and go invest on another game that rewards your time and effort.

reviews.name: Worst support crew
reviews.title: Worst support crew
reviews.text: I tried to retrieve an account that I had in which I knew the email,username,and password but it didn‚Äôt allow me to login.I showed clear cut proof that I was the owner of the account with video evidence. The support team was slow to respond and didn‚Äôt apply anything to the situation they were simply just a fight to stay in contact with on their end. I was given a long list of extremely detailed questions about an account that I had SIX YEARS AGO‚Ä¶ridiculous. The worst part is was the fact that they had no care for your situation and only about doing the minimum they‚Äôre required to do and didn‚Äôt care that I showed a VIDEO OF ME LOGGING INTO THE ACCOUNT as I was stopped from logging in. This by far is one of the worst support teams I‚Äôve ever had to deal with. I‚Äôve had other really bad experiences with the support team in which I never was given a shiny pokemon that I caught after a raid which i only received a compensation of a raid pass which doesn‚Äôt justify for what happened to me. I‚Äôm fed up with it.

reviews.name: FOMO Game, So fun.  Wait, wait, wait.  Tap, tap, tap.  Spin, spin, spin.
reviews.title: FOMO Game, So fun.  Wait, wait, wait.  Tap, tap, tap.  Spin, spin, spin.
reviews.text: It‚Äôs a waiting game and the same stuff over and over. Always waiting for location. Can‚Äôt spin in front of a pokestop. Too much work to wait until app finally recognizes where you are. Turns to a spinner yet you can‚Äôt spin. Even more wait for raids with 95% no players for 5 star raids. In real life, you look like a dummy standing there all by yourself. They should have stats on who waits the most and who joins the most raid and can‚Äôt battle. Trades are a joke. Who wants to trade for bad Pok√©mon to trash? Adventure sync is a joke. Need to access my location to show how much I walked? It‚Äôs already part of the phone. Everyone should have the same access to auto catch and spin without buying those stupid devices.Lost XPs when friends remove you after leveling up.  This is a mess.  Crashes all the time.  Same Pok√©mon in raids over and over again.

Landed every ball on the Pok√©mon with either a great or an excellent shot along with golden berries used. Still won‚Äôt stay in the ball. Then you lose your chance to keep him because of it. It‚Äôs completely bull crap is what it is. If you beat the raid you should get the Pok√©mon simple as that. Not going to keep wasting money on something that doesn‚Äôt change.

(Which doesn‚Äôt usually have a lot anyways) So at that point, you can‚Äôt really make much progress without paying.

reviews.name: Need more potions

reviews.text: This is a great game but there is not enough ways to get potions. The only consistent way to get them is raids but you usually don‚Äôt do raids often.

reviews.name: Suggested Improvements
reviews.title: Suggested Improvements
reviews.text: - add a way to record your battles- add features for car passengers (that‚Äôs where I play it the most) [possibly include a way to verify that you are a passenger)- lower the prices in the store OR provide more ways to earn coins [ex: 1 coin=1 battle victory]- raise the daily limit of poke coins you can obtain from gyms in a day - add a feature that will track the distance traveled in a car (maybe have a locked mode where it tracks the distance but only counts 1/2 or 3/4 of that distance towards your buddy Pok√©mon.)- add ways to battle wild Pok√©mon to improve the max cp/level/hp of the Pok√©mon used (like in the Pok√©mon games on a Nintendo DS)
